post_text:
Dear Heritage family,

The administration is excited to share with you that we have selected a new principal to lead us into the upcoming school year. Cynthia Mendoza is entering her fifth year with Heritage Elementary, most recently serving as assistant principal. We know her love of our students and school will continue to be a great asset in her new role.

Wishing all of our students and parents a wonderful and safe summer. Thank you!
text:
Dear Heritage family,

The administration is excited to share with you that we have selected a new principal to lead us into the upcoming school year. Cynthia Mendoza is entering her fifth year with Heritage Elementary, most recently serving as assistant principal. We know her love of our students and school will continue to be a great asset in her new role.

Wishing all of our students and parents a wonderful and safe summer. Thank you!

post_text:
Character trait: Fairness
The Oxford Dictionary defines “fairness” as “impartial and just treatment or behavior without favoritism or discrimination.” The definition is short, but this can be a hard pillar to demonstrate because, while fairness should be viewed objectively, it’s often subjective; what you think is fair, another may not see the same way.

Parents and students should discuss ways to be fair in everyone’s eyes: play by the rules, take turns and share, be open-minded, listen to others, and treat all people the same.
text:
Character trait: Fairness
The Oxford Dictionary defines “fairness” as “impartial and just treatment or behavior without favoritism or discrimination.” The definition is short, but this can be a hard pillar to demonstrate because, while fairness should be viewed objectively, it’s often subjective; what you think is fair, another may not see the same way.

Parents and students should discuss ways to be fair in everyone’s eyes: play by the rules, take turns and share, be open-minded, listen to others, and treat all people the same.

post_text:
At Heritage we are very proud of our awesome community partnerships and amazing students. So we have to take a moment to brag about our 6th grade super stars who won the 6th Grade Writing Contest. Through our partnership with the Arizona Cardinals, they won game tickets, football and helmets, all signed by Arizona Cardinals wide receiver, Larry Fitzgerald! We had a ton of fun at today’s assembly where the students received their prizes! A huge shout-out to 6th grade teacher, Mrs. Gipson for putting this together, and Jay Littman from the AZ Cardinals!

#gocardinals #beredseered #arizonacardinals #larryfitzgerald

The winners are:

1st Place- Uriah Yazzie-2 tickets to December 1st Cardinals v. Rams game & autographed mini helmet
2nd Place Zion Hayes-signed football
3rd Place- Jordyn Childs-signed football
4th Place- Audrie Castaneda- signed football
5th Place- Paige Staton- signed ball cap
6th place- Max Diaz Herrera-signed ball cap

post_text:
The theme of this year’s annual fall parade is Alma Mater. On Thursday, October 31, at 10 a.m., parents are invited to watch Heritage students parade, each class dressed to represent a different university.

Classes will compete for the best costumes. The winning class will be selected by a panel of local celebrity judges. Bring your family, friends, and a chair, and join us for this creative and inspired annual tradition.

post_text: Today we had the ribbon cutting of our new mural, painted by our K-5 Art Teacher Ana Perez. The students all dressed in green to celebrate the unveiling of our new eco-friendly water bottle fountain and freshly painted mural. Last week our Jr. High NJHS presented a series of Ted Talks to help educate our student body about the challenges facing the environment today and how we can help. Heritage is excited to continue our efforts to help the environment and GO GREEN!

The students all dressed in green to celebrate the unveiling of our new eco-friendly water bottle fountain and freshly painted mural. Last week our Jr. High NJHS presented a series of Ted Talks to help educate our student body about the challenges facing the environment today and how we can help. Heritage is excited to continue our efforts to help the environment and GO GREEN!

post_text:
Today was our first Fire Drill of the year and it was a great success!

We started off with a 1st-5th grade assembly where Principal Dye had a Q and A session with the kids about safety at school. Then the guys down at Rural Metro Fire Department joined us to talk with our Kindergarten and help at our Fire Drill.

Next Thursday will have a Lock Down Drill at 10am.

Good communication and open conversations are the key to a safe and happy school. We are happy be a part of your kiddo’s lives and take keeping them safe very seriously.

#safestschoolinthevalley

post_text: Hey parents, we all know mornings are tough, but please plan according and leave your house a little earlier to beat the rush. Let’s keep the drop off/pick up line moving fast and efficiently. Have a happy and safe day! 😊

post_text:
Kick the school year off right!

Our annual Back-to-School Bash is Friday, August 23, at 7 p.m.

The festivities will include a concert featuring The Heritage Big Staff Band and a special performance by The Heritage Gems. Bring blankets and chairs for a concert under the stars. Food and drinks are welcome and we’ll have a food truck available for purchases.

post_text: Students interested in being class officers may campaign the week of August 19-23, Student Council Election Week. The week will culminate on election day, August 23, with an assembly at 9 a.m. Good luck to everyone running to serve their fellow students!

post_text:
Parents, help our students do their part to win this year's attendance contest by ensuring they are getting to school every day.

Each day a classroom gets perfect attendance, the teacher will put a letter from the word "attendance" on the door. Once the class spells out the entire word – 10 perfect attendance days – they can win a popcorn party and other prizes!

The competition starts Monday!
text:
Parents, help our students do their part to win this year's attendance contest by ensuring they are getting to school every day.

Each day a classroom gets perfect attendance, the teacher will put a letter from the word "attendance" on the door. Once the class spells out the entire word – 10 perfect attendance days – they can win a popcorn party and other prizes!

The competition starts Monday!

post_text:
As the school year is off and running, we'd just like to remind everyone the importance of safety in the school parking lot by implementing these two simple rules:

We ask you to please drive slowly in and around the lot - small children and families are walking and may be difficult to see.

Also, please only turn right onto Glendale Avenue - keep traffic flowing before and after school by making right-hand turns only onto Glendale.

Thank you! And we look forward to a great year with everyone. 😃
text:

Thank you! And we look forward to a great year with everyone. 😃

post_text: Don’t forget that Wednesdays are half-days at Heritage. Every Wednesday, students will be released at 1 p.m. The After-School Program will be available until 6 p.m. unless otherwise noted.

We’ll be honoring the top five ELA and math scores from each grade. Come out and see the top-scoring students at Heritage!

Picture Day is coming up on 08/20/2019!
Order online at inter-state.com/FlyerEntry/42282JF
